intro: Scleranthus tauscheri, commonly known as the Tauscher's knotweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has hairy leaves and produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often growing in disturbed soils and open habitats. Scleranthus tauscheri is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
